protocols.name: Avail Project
protocols.description: Avail aims to accelerate the unification of Web3 using its cutting edge modular technology stack that combines data availability, aggregation, and shared security.

docsIntegration.text: Documentation at https://docs.availproject.org/ with validator setup, light client guide, and developer tools
Integrations: Optimism, Arbitrum Orbit, zkSync rollups. SDKs: Rust SDK, Turbo DA for high-throughput apps
AVAIL token airdrop completed 2024. No new airdrop active October 2025. No slashing mechanism - lower operational risk.

opportunities.entryDescription: Minimum 1,000 AVAIL for direct nomination (or 100 AVAIL via nomination pools)

notes: Validator: 1,000 AVAIL minimum for direct nomination.
No KYC, no waitlist, no slashing.
Earn staking rewards proportional to active stake + DA fees in AVAIL.
Light Client: Minimal resources required (1-2 cores).
No economic rewards - contribution to DA security only.

protocols.name: Aztec
protocols.description: Aztec is a privacy-first Layer 2 (L2) solution built on Ethereum. Its primary purpose is to bring privacy to the otherwise publicly visible transactions on the Ethereum blockchain. Aztec achieves this by operating as a new alternative virtual machine (alt-VM), diverging from EVM compatibility to extend the Ethereum ecosystem with private smart contracts using zero-knowledge proofs. Currently in Adversarial Testnet with over 23,000 active operators.

docsIntegration.text: Official documentation for operators (running sequencers, full nodes, provers) available at https://docs.aztec.network/the_aztec_network/guides/run_nodes
Integrations/tools include Aztec.js (library to interact with contracts) and Aztec.nr (Noir framework for private smart contracts). The network uses Noir for zk circuits.
Setup time: 30-60 minutes. Monthly cost: $20-130 for VPS. Slashing active (3 strikes), home-staker friendly with 20min downtime protection.

notes: Most private way to interact with Aztec
Requires L1 RPC endpoints with blob support.
Full setup requires ~40 machines @ 16 cores/128GB each.

protocols.name: Buildernet
protocols.description: Buildernet is an MEV-focused Layer 2 solution designed to optimize transaction ordering and maximize value extraction opportunities. Operators run sequencers that efficiently order transactions while capturing MEV rewards. The protocol aims to create a more efficient and profitable environment for both users and operators in the MEV landscape.

docsIntegration.text: Buildernet sequencer documentation covers MEV extraction strategies and optimal transaction ordering
MEV toolkit includes flash loan interfaces, arbitrage detection APIs, and profit optimization algorithms

protocols.name: Celestia
protocols.description: Celestia is a modular blockchain specializing in data availability (DA). Light nodes are extremely accessible (even on mobile devices) and critical for Data Availability Sampling security model.

docsIntegration.text: Documentation at https://docs.celestia.org/ covering node setup, DAS mechanics, and rollup integration
Foundation Delegation Program Cohort 5 opened June 1, 2025. Cohort 6 expected late 2025/early 2026.
Light nodes conduct Data Availability Sampling (DAS) and run on mobile devices - no economic rewards but critical for DA security.

opportunities.entryDescription: Need hundreds of thousands to millions of TIA delegated to reach top 100 active set

notes: Foundation Delegation Program offers path via application (KYC, 1+ month testnet operation, non-Hetzner/OVH hosting, 99%+ uptime).
Light Node: Runs on mobile devices, laptops, smartwatches.
Conducts Data Availability Sampling (DAS) critical for network security.
No economic rewards - contribution to DA security model only.
Important for modular blockchain architecture validation.

protocols.name: Commit-Boost
protocols.description: Commit-Boost is an open-source Ethereum validator sidecar. It standardizes communication between validators and third-party protocols, acting as a light, MEV-Boost compatible platform. This enables validators to safely make commitments, including participating in preconfs to potentially boost yield.

docsIntegration.text: Documentation at https://commit-boost.github.io/commit-boost-client/ with node operator and developer guides
Modular architecture supports mev-commit, Bolt Protocol, Tai-yi, inclusion lists via il-boost. MEV-Boost replacement with per-key relay configuration.
Major operators using it: P2P.org, Stakely, Chorus One. No native token, no airdrop - public good maintained by not-for-profit entity.

notes: No additional hardware needed beyond your validator node.
Enables preconfirmation rewards from modules like mev-commit, Bolt, Espresso.
Installation via binary, Docker, or Kubernetes Helm Chart.

protocols.name: EigenDA
protocols.description: EigenDA is a data availability layer built on EigenLayer, providing highly scalable and secure data storage for rollups and other blockchain applications. As an EigenDA operator, you contribute to the network's data availability infrastructure while earning rewards through restaking mechanisms. The protocol leverages Ethereum's security through EigenLayer's restaking primitive.

docsIntegration.text: EigenDA operator documentation includes setup guides for data availability nodes and restaking requirements
Integration tools include EigenDA SDK for rollup developers and monitoring dashboards for operator performance tracking

protocols.name: EtherFi
protocols.description: EtherFi is a liquid staking protocol with $3.26B+ TVL. Operation Solo Staker program offers zero-bond entry for accepted applicants using DVT (Obol for Solo Stakers, SSV for professional operators) to eliminate slashing risk. 40+ operators across multiple cohorts.

docsIntegration.text: Documentation at https://etherfi.gitbook.io/ covering staking, node operation, and Operation Solo Staker program
Uses Obol DVT for Solo Stakers and SSV for professional operators. EigenLayer restaking activated October 15, 2025.
ETHFI Season 2 active with $7M buyback program. 5% operator share on 10-15 validators with quarterly payouts.

opportunities.entryDescription: Requires 2 ETH bond - no application or KYC needed

notes: Operators earn standard staking rewards plus EigenLayer restaking rewards through eETH value accrual.

opportunities.entryDescription: Requires application, KYC, technical competence verification, and 2-year commitment

notes: EtherFi provides full 32 ETH per validator.
Can provide hardware via 2-year payment plan or bring your own.
Operators earn 5% of rewards across 10-15 validators.
Uses Obol DVT for slashing protection.

protocols.name: Lido
protocols.description: Lido is a liquid staking protocol that allows users to stake their ETH while maintaining liquidity through stETH tokens. As a validator operator for Lido, you help secure the Ethereum network while earning staking rewards. Lido democratizes access to Ethereum staking by removing the 32 ETH minimum requirement and technical barriers.

docsIntegration.text: Official validator operator documentation covers node setup, key management, and monitoring requirements
Lido SDK and APIs available for integration with staking infrastructure and reward distribution systems

protocols.name: Puffer Finance
protocols.description: Puffer is a decentralized native liquid restaking protocol (nLRP) built on Eigenlayer, it makes native restaking on Eigenlayer more accessible, allowing anyone to run an Ethereum Proof of Stake (PoS) validator while supercharging their rewards.

docsIntegration.text: Documentation at https://docs.puffer.fi/ covering node requirements, VT system, and pufETH mechanics
VT (Validator Ticket) system: 1 VT burns per day while operating. Minimum 7 VTs maintained or face ejection. VTs are ERC-20 tradeable tokens.
Originally-planned 1 ETH bond option using Secure-Signer (TEE) unavailable on mainnet as of October 2025. Puffer V2 plans minimal pufETH collateral.

opportunities.entryDescription: Requires 2 ETH bond (converted to pufETH) + minimum 28 Validator Tickets (~0.8 ETH)

notes: Total entry ~2.8 ETH. Protocol provides remaining 30 ETH.
1 VT burns per day, minimum 7 VTs maintained.
Operators earn 100% of consensus/execution rewards plus EigenLayer restaking rewards.

protocols.name: Rocket Pool
protocols.description: Rocket Pool is a decentralized Ethereum staking protocol that enables users to stake ETH without requiring the full 32 ETH validator threshold. It combines pooled staking with a trustless node operator network, allowing users to participate as stakers (via the liquid staking token rETH) or node operators (by running minipools).

docsIntegration.text: Comprehensive documentation at https://docs.rocketpool.net/ with Smart Node setup, minipool management, and migration guides
Optional Smoothing Pool socializes MEV and EL rewards across participants for consistent payouts every 28 days
Saturn 1 upgrade (January 19, 2026) introduces 4 ETH minipools with Megapools for easier management. Saturn 2 will offer 1.5 ETH bonds.

opportunities.entryDescription: Requires 8 ETH bond + 0.1 ETH for gas (total 8.1 ETH)

notes: ETH-only minipools earn 5% base commission on 24 ETH borrowed from protocol
Optional RPL staking (10-15% of borrowed ETH) increases commission to 10-14% plus RPL inflation rewards
Operational since November 2021 with proven track record

protocols.name: SSV Network
protocols.description: SSV Network is aÂ decentralized validator infrastructure protocol designed to enable secure and trustless staking for Ethereum and other PoS blockchains. Operators run SSV nodes with no ETH bond required, earning SSV token fees from validator owners who pay for distributed validator clusters (typically 4 operators per validator).

docsIntegration.text: Documentation at https://docs.ssv.network/ covering DVT mechanics, operator guides, and API references
Two-sided marketplace: validator owners pay operators in SSV tokens (typically 1-1.5 SSV/validator/year for verified operators)
Optional Verified Operator status requires KYC/KYB for enhanced trust. Incentivized Mainnet Program ends December 31, 2025.

notes: Must stake SSV tokens for network fees and slashing insurance
Operators set fees in SSV tokens (typically 1-1.5 SSV/validator/year)
Earnings depend on attracting validator owners
Permissionless registration, no KYC unless wanting Verified Operator status
Many operators moved from 4-core to 8-core in 2025 as network scaled

protocols.name: Succinct
protocols.description: Succinct is building a decentralized prover network that enables blockchain applications to be secured by cryptographic truth rather than trust-based systems.

docsIntegration.text: Documentation at https://docs.succinct.xyz/ with prover quickstart, SP1 zkVM guides, and network architecture
Reference implementation available but explicitly 'not competitive with actively optimized provers'. Professional setups use multiple NVIDIA L4s, L40s, 3090s, or 4090s.
PROVE token launched August 5, 2025. Binance airdrop (15M tokens, 1.5% supply) completed July 18-21, 2025 for BNB stakers.

notes: Competitive Production Setup: Multiple NVIDIA L4s, L40s, 3090s, or 4090s in coordinated GPU clusters.
Provers compete in reverse auction, must win bids to earn fees.
